definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
to eat and drink/food and drink

sentences.english: It is possible that you inadvertently took an excessive dose of an over-the-counter preparation.
sentences.chinese: 有可能是你把非处方药吃过量了。

sentences.english: Don't eat up at one and you can have it after a while.
sentences.chinese: 别一下子全吃了，留一点过会儿再吃。

sentences.english: I ate a few minutes ago.
sentences.chinese: 吃了，我几分钟前吃了饭。

sentences.english: Why should cattle not graze near yew trees?
sentences.chinese: 为什么牛不在紫杉附近吃草？

sentences.english: B. That's fine. May be I should have boiled eggs.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，也许我吃水煮蛋算了。

sentences.english: I can't wait to take a bite of the pumpernickel.
sentences.chinese: 我简直迫不及待想吃一口黑包。

sentences.english: Also eat some fruits, milk and a small amount of soft drinks containing carbonic acid gas.
sentences.chinese: 还可吃一些水果，牛奶以及少量含碳酸气的饮料。

sentences.english: After lunch my father dozes in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 吃过午饭后我父亲总在他的椅子上打个盹。

sentences.english: Elisa started at the sound of her husband's voice.
sentences.chinese: 听到丈夫的声音，伊利莎吃了一惊。

sentences.english: The only time its okay to use your fingers is when it's a fish bone.
sentences.chinese: 只有在吃鱼的时候，才可以用手去捏鱼骨头。

sentences.english: They are strictly vegetarian and eat all manner of deep fried food.
sentences.chinese: 他们是严格的食素者，吃各种各样的油炸食品。

sentences.english: They had pears in white wine, with a piece of fruitcake.
sentences.chinese: 他们吃着白葡萄酒腌泡过的梨子，配着水果蛋糕。

sentences.english: Eat fat food less, no-noSmokeWine, answer to often maintain defecate unobstructed .
sentences.chinese: 少吃油腻食物，禁忌烟酒，并应经常保持大便通畅。

sentences.english: I think I need an ice-cream to chill out.
sentences.chinese: 我想吃支冰淇淋放松一下。

sentences.english: For the first three days, they ate nothing.
sentences.chinese: 头三天，他们什么也没吃。

sentences.english: Well cook dumplings with seafood for you.
sentences.chinese: 我们煮海鲜水饺给你吃。

definition: to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
way of eating/how something is eaten/how a dish is prepared/the way a dish is to be cooked
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
